abstract.p: BNP Paribas's first-half operating income rises 24 percent, to 2.81 billion euros, or $2.5 billion; photo (S)

block.p: The French banking group BNP Paribas, buoyed by its asset management and retail banking business outside France, said first-half operating income rose 24 percent, to 2.81 billion euros, or $2.5 billion, from a pro forma 2.27 billion euros a year earlier. The report combined first-half results for the first time since the takeover of Paribas by Banque Nationale de Paris a year ago. The combined bank's chairman, Michel Pebereau, sought to counter reports of high-level defections from the Paribas investment banking arm, saying that integration of the banks was proceeding satisfactorily ''despite the inherent difficulties associated with such a merger.''
